item.title: Shui Ka-chun, Hong Kong Activist, Dies
item.description: A social worker and teacher imprisoned for his activism, he later wrote about the toll of incarceration and worked to help others behind bars.

item.title: Lebanon Turns a Political Page as Hezbollah’s Hold Is Weakened
item.description: A stinging defeat in war has left the once untouchable group on its most uncertain footing in years.

item.title: Venezuela’s Autocrat Detains U.S. Citizens As He Tightens Grip on Power
item.description: President Nicolás Maduro will be sworn in for another six years on Friday, and he is hoping to use foreign prisoners to get his way on the global stag...

item.title: Pink Fire Retardant, a Dramatic Wildfire Weapon, Poses Its Own Dangers
item.description: It’s widely used because it can slow flames in ways that water can’t. But it also contains heavy metals and other harmful compounds.
